result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ANTHONY L. ECKSTEIN

records.addlTxt: 10:09 AM Defendant ANTHONY L. ECKSTEIN in court.  Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court for ANTHONY L. ECKSTEIN.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Request to adjourn the plea/sentencing and remove the jury trial argued by Defense.  No objection from the State.

Add'l Cond:    Absolute sobriety.    No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.  Due to COVID-19 you will need to call 920-236-4906 BEFORE reporting.
8/5 - the court removed the Drug 24/7.

10:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ANTHONY L. ECKSTEIN in court.  Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court for ANTHONY L. ECKSTEIN.  Attorney Ulrich was just appointed and requests to reschedule the JT.  Defense requests to remove the 24/7 program.  The State takes no position.  The court will removed the 24/7 program.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to Withdrawal forwarded to Judge for signature.

Adjustment Number: 22A 339185,
Payable Number: 323619,
Receipt Number: 22R 022489,
Amount: $20.00

01:37 PM Defendant ANTHONY L. ECKSTEIN in court with attorney Emma K Blankschein.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Defendant requests to be heard on bond - requests D24/7 to be removed from bond conditions due to work schedule; State objects.  Court denies request.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:55 AM Defendant ANTHONY L. ECKSTEIN in court with attorney Emma K Blankschein.  Defendant ANTHONY L. ECKSTEIN in custody.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ANTHONY L. ECKSTEIN appeared by video means with Attorney.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 8:58.  Arraignment scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Unsigned Bail/Bond form returned from WCJ - DE refused to sign on 04-18-2022

Add'l Cond:    Absolute sobriety.    No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.    Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.    You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.  Due to COVID-19 you will need to call 920-236-4906 BEFORE reporting.
